text: John Foster (1770 - April 1792), styled The Honourable, was an Anglo-Irish politician. Foster was the son of John Foster, 1st Baron Oriel and Margaretta, Viscountess Ferrard.Burke's Peerage (1970) He was educated at Eton College and Trinity College, Cambridge. Foster served as the Member of Parliament (MP) for Dunleer in the Irish House of Commons between 1790 and his early death in 1792.ThePeerage.com (entry #648675) http://www.thepeerage.com/p64868.htm#i648675 (Accessed 5 June 2015) His brother Thomas Henry Foster succeeded him as MP. ==References== Category:1770 births Category:1792 deaths Category:Alumni of Trinity College, Cambridge Category:18th-century Anglo-Irish people Category:Eldest sons of barons Category:Irish MPs 1790–1797 Category:People educated at Eton College Category:Members of the Parliament of Ireland (pre-1801) for County Louth constituencies
title: John Foster (Dunleer MP)
